translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that the mind is merely reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te 'du ba'i 'brel pa 'am gzhan gyis bdag la gnas pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'du ba'i 'brel pa 'am gzhan gyis bdag la gnas pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the mind itself that abides in the self through the connection of aggregation or something else,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is also unreasonable.

original: bdag la gnas pa'i blo nyid na'ang //üîΩ'bad rtsol la sogs phan tshun du //
analyzed: bdag la gnas pa'i blo nyid na'ang // 'bad rtsol la sogs phan tshun du //
translated: If the mind itself abides in the self,

original: 'du pa'i phyir na blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du pa'i phyir na blor 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be the mind because of the mutual aggregation of effort and so on.

original: bdag la gnas pa'ang ji ltar rig /'bad rtsol la sogs phan tshun dran pa dag kyang myong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la gnas pa'ang ji ltar rig /'bad rtsol la sogs phan tshun dran pa dag kyang myong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How could it be known to exist in the self?  It follows that the self would experience the mutual memory of effort, etc.

original: bdag la gnas par gang gis nges /
analyzed: bdag la gnas par gang gis nges /
translated: By what is it ascertained that it exists in the self?

original: blo gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyis so //
translated: By another cognition.

original: blo nyid nges pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: blo nyid nges pa ma yin nam //
translated: Isn‚Äôt cognition itself uncertain?

original: de ji ltar blo gzhan gyis zhes brjod //
analyzed: de ji ltar blo gzhan gyis zhes brjod //
translated: How can it be said that another cognition is?

original: blo gnyi ga bdag la gnas pa yin na ji ltar phan tshun du 'dzin te /
analyzed: blo gnyi ga bdag la gnas pa yin na ji ltar phan tshun du 'dzin te /
translated: If both cognitions exist in the self, how can they apprehend each other?

original: yul gcig pa nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gcig pa nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different, since they have the same object.

original: de ltar tha dad par rtogs ma mo de'i tshe bdag kyang tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur bas na 'di phan tshun rnam par 'byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ltar tha dad par rtogs ma mo de'i tshe bdag kyang tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur bas na 'di phan tshun rnam par 'byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: If they are realized as different, then the self would also be realized as different. Therefore, they would be mutually exclusive.

original: / bdag ma rtogs par ni der gnas pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / bdag ma rtogs par ni der gnas pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the self is not realized, it is not realized as existing there.

original: ma rtogs pa'i bdag ji ltar blo'i rten du blos 'dzin //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i bdag ji ltar blo'i rten du blos 'dzin //
translated: How can the self, which is not realized, be apprehended by cognition as the basis of cognition?

original: gzugs la sogs pa blos rtogs /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa blos rtogs /
translated: Cognition is realized by the self.

original: rtogs kyang bdag la gnas pa'i blo'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs kyang bdag la gnas pa'i blo'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if they were to be realized, they would not be objects of the cognition that resides in the self.

original: de dag ni bdag la gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag la gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they do not reside in the self.

original: bdag khyab par ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag khyab par ma yin nam /
translated: Is the self not all-pervading?

original: ji ltar de la mi gnas pa nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar de la mi gnas pa nyid yin /
translated: How could it not reside in them?

original: der 'du ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: der 'du ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it does not assemble there.

original: ji ltar 'du ba ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du ba ma yin /
translated: How does it not assemble there?

original: der rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not realize them.

original: 'o na blo yang bdag la rtogs pa med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'o na blo yang bdag la rtogs pa med pa kho na ste /
translated: But cognition also does not realize the self,

original: de las tha dad par bdag rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad par bdag rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is not realized as distinct from it.

original: gal te re zhig bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi rtogs pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te re zhig bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi rtogs pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Now, if this realization, which has the nature of activity, does not exist,

original: de la gdon mi za bar byed pa po yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gdon mi za bar byed pa po yod par 'gyur te /
translated: then the agent must exist, because

original: byed pa po med pa'i bya ba ni mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i bya ba ni mi srid do zhe na /
translated: an activity without an agent is impossible.

original: mig la sogs pa gang las 'di skyes bu de nyid byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gang las 'di skyes bu de nyid byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the person is the agent of that which arises from the eye and so on?

original: de dag ni byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are the agent.

original: byed pa po gzhan brtags pas ci bya /
analyzed: byed pa po gzhan brtags pas ci bya /
translated: What is the use of postulating some other agent?

original: de dag nyid byed pa po yin mod /
analyzed: de dag nyid byed pa po yin mod /
translated: Those very things are the agent.

original: de dag ni byed pa po gzhan med na byed par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni byed pa po gzhan med na byed par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But they are not such that they do not act without another agent.

original: yang na lus nyid byed pa po yin pas gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: yang na lus nyid byed pa po yin pas gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: Or else, since the body itself is the agent, what is the use of another?

original: 'o na blo lus kyi nang du tshud pas nang du phyogs par snang bar rtogs pa yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi blo @95a * //
analyzed: 'o na blo lus kyi nang du tshud pas nang du phyogs par snang bar rtogs pa yin no // de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi blo @95a * //
translated: Well, since the mind is contained within the body, it is understood that it appears to be internal.

original: gzhan du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: For that very reason, the mind of another is understood to be external.

original: 'o na lus kyi phyogs su 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig kyang blo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na lus kyi phyogs su 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig kyang blo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Well, then, some part of the body would be the mind itself.

original: des na rang rig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: des na rang rig pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if it is not reflexive awareness,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: it is the same for form and so on.

original: des na 'dra ba thams cad phan tshun rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dra ba thams cad phan tshun rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all that is similar would be mutually cognizable.

original: de'i phyir rang rig ba nyid kyis rang bzhin gzhan las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig ba nyid kyis rang bzhin gzhan las ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is by reflexive awareness that one turns away from other natures.

original: gal te blo 'dra de myong na //
analyzed: gal te blo 'dra de myong na //
translated: If the mind is experienced as similar to that,

original: 'dra ba thams cad don rig pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dra ba thams cad don rig pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not that all that is similar is cognized as an object.

original: 'on kyang blor gyur ba'i 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang blor gyur ba'i 'dra ba'o //
translated: But the similarity is in the cognition.

original: blo la brten pa'i 'dra ba don rig pa yin gyi //
analyzed: blo la brten pa'i 'dra ba don rig pa yin gyi //
translated: The similarity that is based on the cognition is the cognition of the object.

original: rig pa tsam mam /
analyzed: rig pa tsam mam /
translated: It is not mere cognition,

original: 'dra ba tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: nor is it mere similarity.

original: rig pa tsam yin na ni /
analyzed: rig pa tsam yin na ni /
translated: If it were mere cognition,

original: rig pa tsam kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rig pa tsam kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: it would be mere cognition alone,

original: don rig par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don rig par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not be the cognition of an object.

original: 'dra ba tsam yin pa ni don rnams kyang phan tshun rig par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam yin pa ni don rnams kyang phan tshun rig par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it were mere similarity, it would follow absurdly that objects would also cognize each other.

original: de ltar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi rung ste /
translated: But that is not correct either.

original: 'di ltar / de ni 'dra las myong ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ni 'dra las myong ma yin //
translated: Because: It is not experienced from similarity.üîΩIf the definition of experience is similarity, then at that time the object of similarity would also be experienced.

original: gal te 'dra ba myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe 'dra ba'i don yang myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la blor 'gyur ba zhes lan btab pa yin na de la ni phan tshun rigs pa yin na de dag kyang blor thal bar 'gyur ba
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe 'dra ba'i don yang myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la blor 'gyur ba zhes lan btab pa yin na de la ni phan tshun rigs pa yin na de dag kyang blor thal bar 'gyur ba
translated: If the answer is that it is in the cognition, then it is reasonable that they are mutually related, but it would follow that they are cognitions.

original: brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: brjod pa nyid do //
translated: That is just what was said.

original: myong bar thal lo zhes brjod pa dag gang yin pa de dag blo nyid do zhes brjod pa 'di la yang de nyid lan du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: myong bar thal lo zhes brjod pa dag gang yin pa de dag blo nyid do zhes brjod pa 'di la yang de nyid lan du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But when you say that the object of experience is the mind itself, how can that be the answer?

original: gang gi phyir blo dang myong ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis brjod par bya ba tha dad nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo dang myong ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis brjod par bya ba tha dad nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the so-called mind and experience are not different things.

original: des na khyad par gzhan nyid brjod par bya ba yin la de yang 'dra ba las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par gzhan nyid brjod par bya ba yin la de yang 'dra ba las gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference is the object of expression, and that is different from the similar.

original: gal te 'dra ba'i don rnams phan tshun 'dzin par byed pa ma yin par mthong la blos ni 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na gal te de lta na 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dra ba blo yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba'i don rnams phan tshun 'dzin par byed pa ma yin par mthong la blos ni 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na gal te de lta na 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dra ba blo yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the objects of similar meaning are not seen to apprehend each other, but the mind has the nature of apprehending, then if that is so, the mind is similar in having the nature of apprehending.

original: 'dra ba tsam gyis 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir blo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam gyis 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir blo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind has the nature of apprehending by mere similarity, then form and so on would also be apprehending and it follows that they would be the mind.

original: 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it does not apprehend itself.

original: gal te 'dzin par byed pa nyid rnam par gnas pa yod na /
analyzed: gal te 'dzin par byed pa nyid rnam par gnas pa yod na /
translated: If the act of apprehending exists,

original: 'ga' zhig ni 'dzin par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni 'dzin par byed pa yin la /
translated: then some would be the act of apprehending,

original: gzhan ni bzlog par rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin na de nyid ni gnas pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan ni bzlog par rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin na de nyid ni gnas pa med do //
translated: and others would be the act of not apprehending. But that is not so.

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan par byed pa yin na /
translated: If it is different from form, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra ba rang rig pa ma yin pa'i rang @95b bzhin ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra ba rang rig pa ma yin pa'i rang @95b bzhin ma yin nam /
translated: then it is not the nature of self-awareness, which is like form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan yin /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan yin /
translated: If it is different from form, etc.,

original: der rtogs pa la ni tshad ma yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der rtogs pa la ni tshad ma yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no valid cognition to understand that.

original: don gyi gzung ba nyid de lta ma yin na med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi gzung ba nyid de lta ma yin na med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the object of apprehension is not like that, it would not exist.

original: ji ltar mthong ba de ltar yin du zad mod /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba de ltar yin du zad mod /
translated: It is just as it is seen.

original: gzhan gyis ci bya de'i phyir rang rig pa nyid khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci bya de'i phyir rang rig pa nyid khyad par yin no //
translated: What else is there? Therefore, self-awareness is the distinguishing feature.

original: de lta yin dang ; khyad par gang las gzugs la sogs pa'i don las ldog pa de nyid blo yin pas 'dra ba las ni blo ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang ; khyad par gang las gzugs la sogs pa'i don las ldog pa de nyid blo yin pas 'dra ba las ni blo ma yin no //
translated: then the mind would be the same as the object, such as form, from which it is distinguished.

original: rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo nyid du 'gyur ba'i 'dra ba gang yin pa de rigs pa yin pas mtshan nyid blo yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo nyid du 'gyur ba'i 'dra ba gang yin pa de rigs pa yin pas mtshan nyid blo yin gyi /
translated: The reason why it is the mind is that it is similar to the mind that has the characteristic of self-awareness. Therefore the mind is characterized by that,

original: 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not characterized by similarity.

original: 'o na 'dra ba'i don du 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dra ba'i don du 'dod ce na /
translated: If it is asserted that it is similar,

original: des byas pa'i myong ba nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir de 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: des byas pa'i myong ba nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir de 'dod pa yin no //
translated: then it is asserted because it is the cause of the ascertainment of experience produced by that.

original: des na blo yis na 'dra ba zhes bya bar 'gyur bas na rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid blo'i khyad par nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na blo yis na 'dra ba zhes bya bar 'gyur bas na rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid blo'i khyad par nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, since it is said that the mind is similar, the mind is distinguished by the characteristic of self-awareness.

original: 'dra ba ni de las gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni de las gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarity is not something other than that.

original: 'o na blo nyid kyang 'dra ba'i khyad par yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na blo nyid kyang 'dra ba'i khyad par yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then the mind itself is distinguished by similarity.

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It is not something other than that.

original: 'di ni bden mod kyi de lta na yang phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni bden mod kyi de lta na yang phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la /
translated: This is true, but in the case of the proponents of external objects,

original: 'dra ba rang rig pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dra ba rang rig pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: the similarity is related to mere self-awareness.

original: rang rig pa ni 'dra ba tsam las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni 'dra ba tsam las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Self-awareness does not arise from mere similarity.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / de yi myong ba de rang nyid //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de yi myong ba de rang nyid //
translated: Its experience is itself.

original: de ni 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan min //
analyzed: de ni 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan min //
translated: That is not the reason for similarity.

original: 'dra pa ni rang rig rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: 'dra pa ni rang rig rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Similarity is the reason for self-awareness.

original: gal te rtogs pa gzhan med par rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed na /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa gzhan med par rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed na /
translated: If it manifests its own nature without the realization of another,

original: de la 'dra bas ci bya /
analyzed: de la 'dra bas ci bya /
translated: what is the use of similarity?

original: gal te 'di gzhan gyis 'dra ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di gzhan gyis 'dra ba yin na /
translated: If it is similar to another,

original: de'i tshe de ltar rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ltar rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: then it is reasonable that it is like that.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin no zhes /
translated: But it is not reasonable at other times.

original: de ltar ni de brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni de brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: But it should not be analyzed in that way.

original: chus khyer ba la rags gzugs pas ci bya zhes bya ba'i tshul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chus khyer ba la rags gzugs pas ci bya zhes bya ba'i tshul du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be like saying, ‚ÄúWhat is the use of a raft when one is already carried away by the water?‚Äù

original: da ni 'dra bas ci bya zhes brjod par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dra bas ci bya zhes brjod par yang mi bya ste /
translated: Now, it should not be said, ‚ÄúWhat is the use of similarity?‚ÄùüîΩBecause:

original: 'di ltar / bya ba las kyi rnam gzhag ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bya ba las kyi rnam gzhag ni //
translated: The presentation of the activity of karma

original: 'di ni 'jig rten na rgyur 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten na rgyur 'gyur //
translated: This is the cause in the world.

original: tha dad pa'i yul rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni 'dis rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i yul rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni 'dis rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: The nature of self-awareness of different objects is established by this,

original: 'dra ba las gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: 'dra ba las gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: not by something else that is similar.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i las dang ser po la sogs par rig go zhes bya ba dang / las so sor nges pa don du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i las dang ser po la sogs par rig go zhes bya ba dang / las so sor nges pa don du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that blue and so on are the object and yellow and so on are the cognition, and the determination of the object is asserted to be the purpose.

original: re zhig phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i ltar na /
analyzed: re zhig phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i ltar na /
translated: First, according to those who advocate external objects,

original: phyi rol sngon po la sogs pas rang rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol sngon po la sogs pas rang rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: external blue and so on are not self-awareness.

original: des na 'dra ba'i dngos po rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dra ba'i dngos po rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the similar thing that is to be established.

original: @96a * // de lta ma yin na 'jig rten na sngon po la sogs pa phyi'i don rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @96a * // de lta ma yin na 'jig rten na sngon po la sogs pa phyi'i don rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, in the world, external objects such as blue would not be established,üîΩbecause in that case,

original: 'di ltar / rang gi ngo bo'i rang bzhin de'i //üîΩmyong ba sgro 'dogs 'khrul pa las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang gi ngo bo'i rang bzhin de'i // myong ba sgro 'dogs 'khrul pa las //
translated: the experience of that natureüîΩis from superimposition and error.üîΩThe experience of blue and so on

original: stsogs pa myong bar grags yin gyi //
analyzed: stsogs pa myong bar grags yin gyi //
translated: is renowned as the experience of the collection of sense faculties and so on.

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid myong las min //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid myong las min //
translated: Nor is it the experience of something else.

original: rig pa'i rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i myong ba thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi rgyun 'jug pa can gyi 'khrul pas phyi rol sngon po la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pas sngon po la sogs pa
analyzed: rig pa'i rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i myong ba thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi rgyun 'jug pa can gyi 'khrul pas phyi rol sngon po la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pas sngon po la sogs pa
translated: The nature of consciousness is the experience of the essence of consciousness itself. The experience of the essence of blue, etc., is the error that occurs in the beginningless continuum of predispositions. It superimposes external objects such as blue, etc.,

original: nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: on the essence of consciousness itself.üîΩThus, the experience of blue, etc., is the experience of consciousness itself.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni 'ga' yang myong ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni 'ga' yang myong ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The essence of blue, etc., which is other than consciousness, is not at all the object of experience.

original: rig pa nyams su myong ba nyid nye bar btags nas myong ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa nyams su myong ba nyid nye bar btags nas myong ba yin no //
translated: The experience of consciousness itself is designated as the experience of blue, etc.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / gzhan rig na yang don bzhin du //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhan rig na yang don bzhin du //
translated: Even if it cognizes something else,

original: gal te de yi ngo bo rtogs //
analyzed: gal te de yi ngo bo rtogs //
translated: it cognizes its own essence, like the object.

original: 'di ni bdag gis shes zhes ba'i //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis shes zhes ba'i //
translated: The convention ‚ÄúI know this‚Äù

original: tha snyad rab tu 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: tha snyad rab tu 'jug pa yin //
translated: is used when it cognizes its own essence.

original: de'i tshe mtshan nyid gzhan rig pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan nyid gzhan rig pa na /
translated: When it cognizes the essence of something else,

original: 'di ni bdag cag gis rig pa nyid do zhes 'jig rten tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag cag gis rig pa nyid do zhes 'jig rten tha snyad byed do //
translated: This is what we call self-awareness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten na smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten na smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is mentioned in the world.

original: don dam par ni rang rig pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: don dam par ni rang rig pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But ultimately, it is only self-awareness.

original: blo yi dngos sogs dngos min na //
analyzed: blo yi dngos sogs dngos min na //
translated: If cognition is not the object, etc.,

original: de ni ji ltar de myong yin //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar de myong yin //
translated: how can it experience itself?

original: gal te rig pa nyid bdag nyid sngon po'i rnam par gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rig pa nyid bdag nyid sngon po'i rnam par gsal ba yin na /
translated: If cognition itself is manifest in the form of blue,

original: tshad ma gang la brten nas phyi'i don rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad ma gang la brten nas phyi'i don rig par 'gyur /
translated: on what basis is the external object cognized?

original: de la mngon sum ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mngon sum ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception does not exist there,

original: de ni rang rig pa tsam gyis mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang rig pa tsam gyis mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it terminates with mere self-awareness.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sngon po snang ba yang med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sngon po snang ba yang med do //
translated: And there is no appearance of anything other than that,

original: sngon po rnam pa nyid rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po rnam pa nyid rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no awareness of the aspect of blue itself.

original: 'on te don de nyid kyi bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te don de nyid kyi bdag nyid yin na /
translated: But if it is of the nature of that object,

original: de myong ba gzhan gyis rang bzhin gyis rig pa 'am rig pa ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de myong ba gzhan gyis rang bzhin gyis rig pa 'am rig pa ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: is it experienced as other or as itself?

original: gal te ma rig pa de ji ltar de'i myong ba yin rang gi ngo bos shes pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa de ji ltar de'i myong ba yin rang gi ngo bos shes pa ma yin pa /
translated: If that ignorance is not essentially consciousness, how could it be the experience of that?

original: 'di'i rig pa zhes 'brel ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di'i rig pa zhes 'brel ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What connection is there between it and the term ‚Äúawareness‚Äù?

original: rig go zhe na de ltar yang dus mtshungs pa 'am gzhan du rig kyang rung ste ;
analyzed: rig go zhe na de ltar yang dus mtshungs pa 'am gzhan du rig kyang rung ste ;
translated: If it is awareness, then it is either simultaneous with it or it is awareness of it at another time.üîΩIn either case, how could it be that one thing makes the other aware?üîΩIf it is the case that these two are things that are aware of their own nature, then, as in the case of the object of awareness and awareness, the object of knowledge and the knower would be the same.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis rig par byed pa yin 'di gnyis kyis rang gi rang bzhin de nyid rig pa'i ji ltar rig bya rig byed kyi dngos po yin sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu gyur pa yin na ni de'i rang bzhin rig pa las der brtag pa'i
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis rig par byed pa yin 'di gnyis kyis rang gi rang bzhin de nyid rig pa'i ji ltar rig bya rig byed kyi dngos po yin sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu gyur pa yin na ni de'i rang bzhin rig pa las der brtag pa'i
translated: If it is the case that blue and so on are hidden objects, then the awareness of their nature would be the means of knowing them.

original: phyir 'dis 'di shes so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phyir 'dis 'di shes so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In that case, it would be possible to make the convention ‚ÄúThis knows that.‚Äù

original: @96b dngos su rig na ni gnyis phan tshun 'brel par rig la zhes bya ba'i tshad ma 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @96b dngos su rig na ni gnyis phan tshun 'brel par rig la zhes bya ba'i tshad ma 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is the case that they are directly perceived, then there is no valid cognition whatsoever that is the mutual awareness of the two.

original: de'i phyir rang rig par 'gyur ba yin pa'i rig par 'gyur ba gzhan gyis shes pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid blang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig par 'gyur ba yin pa'i rig par 'gyur ba gzhan gyis shes pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid blang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is this very statement ‚Äúconsciousness is known by itself‚Äù that should be accepted.

original: rang rig pa tsam ni rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa tsam ni rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Mere self-awareness is not the nature of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang 'dra bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ma rig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dra bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ma rig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that it is similar, is it not non-awareness?

original: ma yin te 'dra ba tsam las rig pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'dra ba tsam las rig pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because awareness is not established from mere similarity.

original: rang rig par 'gyur ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig par 'gyur ba'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is self-aware,

original: gal te de lta na yang rig pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur mod 'dra bas ci bya gal te 'dra ba ma yin na rang rig par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rig pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur mod 'dra bas ci bya gal te 'dra ba ma yin na rang rig par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: even so, it would be the nature of consciousness. What is the use of similarity? If it is not similar, would it not be non-self-aware?

original: ci 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na ;
analyzed: ci 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na ;
translated: What would happen?

original: gal te 'dra ba med kyang 'gyur ba yin na 'dra ba des ci bya /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba med kyang 'gyur ba yin na 'dra ba des ci bya /
translated: If it were self-aware even without similarity, what would that similarity do?

original: 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: It would be self-aware.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na 'dra ba las rig pa yin no zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na 'dra ba las rig pa yin no zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that awareness is from similarity because it does not exist,

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that does not exist.

original: 'di ltar / gang tshe myong ba'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang tshe myong ba'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: When the nature of experience

original: 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan ma yin na //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan ma yin na //
translated: Is not the reason for similarity,

original: 'di rang nyid du grub pas na //
analyzed: 'di rang nyid du grub pas na //
translated: Since it is established in itself,

original: don gyis ci zhig nye bar sgrub //
analyzed: don gyis ci zhig nye bar sgrub //
translated: What purpose is served by the object?

original: gang gi rig pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: gang gi rig pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin la /
translated: If it has the nature of awareness, it is the essence of that.

original: de'i rang bzhin yang rang nyid grub pa des na 'dra ba las rig pa yin zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yang rang nyid grub pa des na 'dra ba las rig pa yin zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
translated: And if it is the nature of that, since it is established in itself, what connection is there with the statement ‚ÄúIt is awareness due to similarity‚Äù?

original: gal te rang bzhin de med na rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du skyes par gyur kyang ldog par 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin de med na rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du skyes par gyur kyang ldog par 'gyur ram ci /
translated: If it lacks that nature, then even if it were produced as the nature of self-awareness, would it not cease to be?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin de rang nyid las grub pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin de rang nyid las grub pas na /
translated: Therefore, since that nature is established from itself,

original: gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of anything else?

original: des don rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des don rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt becomes the awareness of the object,‚Äù

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also illogical.

original: gal te bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gzhan dang 'dra bar rig pa de lta na yang rig mod des don rig par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gzhan dang 'dra bar rig pa de lta na yang rig mod des don rig par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If the nature of itself is awareness of another, then even if it is aware, how could it become the awareness of the object?

original: des na ji ltar don dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar don dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Therefore, how could it be related to an object?

original: don gyi rig pa zhes rab tu brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyi rig pa zhes rab tu brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe cognition of an object‚ÄùüîΩbecause it is the cognition of an object.

original: gang gis rig par 'gyur ba don ni rang rig pa rjes su zhugs pa ma yin pa des na don rig pa zhes bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: gang gis rig par 'gyur ba don ni rang rig pa rjes su zhugs pa ma yin pa des na don rig pa zhes bya ba ni med do //
translated: Since it is not the case that it is the cognition of itself, it is not the cognition of an object.

original: gal te gzhan yang 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis rig pa yin na de'i tshe don ma yin pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan yang 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis rig pa yin na de'i tshe don ma yin pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if it is the cognition of an object because it is similar to it, then it would be the cognition of a great many things that are not objects.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / bdag nyid kun gyi 'dra na ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag nyid kun gyi 'dra na ni //
translated: If it is similar to all of itself,

original: shes pa shes pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa shes pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: then cognition would not be cognition.

original: cha 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs na ni //
analyzed: cha 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs na ni //
translated: If it is similar to some part of itself,

original: thams cad thams cad kyis myong 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyis myong 'gyur //
translated: then everything would experience everything.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi 'dra ba yin na ni bye brag mtha' dag dang bral bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i tshe na 'di don gyi khyad par @97a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi 'dra ba yin na ni bye brag mtha' dag dang bral bar 'gyur ro // de'i tshe na 'di don gyi khyad par @97a * //
translated: If it is similar to all of itself, then it would be free from all distinctions.

original: gzhan bzhin du don nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan bzhin du don nyid yin pas /
translated: At that time, it would be an object just like any other object.

original: ji ltar de shes pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar de shes pa yin /
translated: How could it be the cognition of itself?

original: shes pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'gyur ba yin na ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'gyur ba yin na ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is distinguished by consciousness itself, then it is not the same in all respects.

original: cha 'ga' zhig gi 'dra ba yang yin na de'i tshe thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: cha 'ga' zhig gi 'dra ba yang yin na de'i tshe thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the same in some part, then at that time all would know all,

original: thams cad kyang cha 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs pa dang bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang cha 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs pa dang bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all are not devoid of being the same in some part.

original: rtogs pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs pa rnam pa gzhan thams cad kyis mtshungs pa nyid kyis na rig pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs pa rnam pa gzhan thams cad kyis mtshungs pa nyid kyis na rig pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is knowledge because of being the same in all other aspects as the aspect that is known,

original: sngon po mtha' dag rig par thal lo //üîΩgang las skyes pa de nyid rig pa yin no zhe na /üîΩgal te de las skyes su chug pa de lta na yang rig pa zhes bya ba'i dag las yin /
analyzed: sngon po mtha' dag rig par thal lo // gang las skyes pa de nyid rig pa yin no zhe na / gal te de las skyes su chug pa de lta na yang rig pa zhes bya ba'i dag las yin /
translated: then it follows that all blue would be known.üîΩIf it is knowledge because of being produced from that,

original: de'i rang bzhin rig pa las rig pa yin gyi de las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rig pa las rig pa yin gyi de las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then even though it is produced from that, it is knowledge because of being of the nature of knowledge, not because of being produced from that.

original: gang mtshe ma dag phan tshun bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po ma yin pa de lta na yang gcig rig na gzhan yang rig par tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang mtshe ma dag phan tshun bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po ma yin pa de lta na yang gcig rig na gzhan yang rig par tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: Although the two eyes are not things that mutually produce each other, when one is cognized, the other is also conventionally cognized.

original: gal te gang las skyes pa dang 'dra ba de rig pa yin no de'i tshe /üîΩji ltar sngo stsogs ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te gang las skyes pa dang 'dra ba de rig pa yin no de'i tshe / ji ltar sngo stsogs ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: If it is said that what is similar to what arises is cognized,üîΩthen how is it that you assert

original: sngon sogs nyams su myong bar 'dod //
analyzed: sngon sogs nyams su myong bar 'dod //
translated: that blue and so on are experienced because of their nature?

original: de bzhin nyams myong ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin nyams myong ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: In the same way, since experience has the nature of experience,

original: de yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur //
translated: it is also experienced.

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni rig pa dang mtshungs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni rig pa dang mtshungs pa nyid yin la /
translated: Since it is similar to cognition in having the nature of realization,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang sngon po la sogs pa dang yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang sngon po la sogs pa dang yin no //
translated: and since blue and so on have the nature of blue and so on,

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa rig pa bzhin du nyams su myong ba rig par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa rig pa bzhin du nyams su myong ba rig par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then just as blue and so on are cognized, so too experience is cognized.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa la yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa myong ba yang nye bar 'jog pa can du 'gyur ro zhes kyang brtag par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa la yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa myong ba yang nye bar 'jog pa can du 'gyur ro zhes kyang brtag par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Or, since it is also the case that blue, etc. are posited, the experience of blue, etc. would also be posited.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: 'di skad skra shad la sogs pa snang la /üîΩnye bar gzhag pa rtogs pa min //
analyzed: 'di skad skra shad la sogs pa snang la / nye bar gzhag pa rtogs pa min //
translated: because, although the appearance of floating hair, etc.üîΩis perceived, the positing of floating hair, etc. is not perceived.

original: nye bar gzhag pa tha dad pa rtogs pa'ang rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag pa tha dad pa rtogs pa'ang rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that the positing of the object is perceived, but not the positing of the cognition itself.

original: rab rib can gyis nye bar dmigs pa'i skra shad du snang ba la ni skra shad nye bar gzhag par rtogs pa nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis nye bar dmigs pa'i skra shad du snang ba la ni skra shad nye bar gzhag par rtogs pa nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of floating hair, etc. that is perceived by one with an eye disease cannot be the positing of floating hair, etc.

original: de la yang sngar mthong ba'i skra las yin no zhes thams cad du rnam pa 'di nyid brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang sngar mthong ba'i skra las yin no zhes thams cad du rnam pa 'di nyid brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: In this case, too, the same procedure should be followed: ‚ÄúIt is from previously seen hair that this arises.‚Äù

original: ji ltar sngon po'i rnam pa mthong ba las de'i rigs can gyi sngon po rtogs pa de bzhin du nye bar gzhag pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po'i rnam pa mthong ba las de'i rigs can gyi sngon po rtogs pa de bzhin du nye bar gzhag pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the cognition of blue, etc. is from the appearance of the aspect of blue, etc., so too the positing of blue, etc. would be without a cause.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a contradiction, because

original: don rtogs pa la 'brel pa @97b bzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs pa la 'brel pa @97b bzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no relation between the word and the object that is understood.

original: don ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is to be inferred,

original: mthong ba snga ma ni skyed par byed pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba snga ma ni skyed par byed pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previous perception is seen to be productive.

original: don ni 'gar yang mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'gar yang mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: The object is never seen,

original: thams cad du rtsod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du rtsod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is always a dispute about it.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa rnam pa gzhan yin la /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa rnam pa gzhan yin la /
translated: What is the other kind of immediately antecedent condition?

original: nye bar 'jog par byed pa gang yin zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar 'jog par byed pa gang yin zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: What is it that is posited?üîΩNo, because it is seen that even when the lac dye is destroyed, the cloth is posited.

original: rgya skyegs kyi khu ba la sogs pa chod pa yang nye bar gzhag pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes 'di ni lan cig ma yin par bstan zin to //
analyzed: rgya skyegs kyi khu ba la sogs pa chod pa yang nye bar gzhag pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes 'di ni lan cig ma yin par bstan zin to //
translated: This has been explained more than once.

original: 'on te yang /
analyzed: 'on te yang /
translated: But if you say,

original: nyams myong nyams su myong ngo zhes //
analyzed: nyams myong nyams su myong ngo zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúI experience the experience,‚Äù

original: don bzhin du ni nges min pa //
analyzed: don bzhin du ni nges min pa //
translated: and you are not certain that it is like the object,

original: de'i phyir nyes pa med ce na //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa med ce na //
translated: then there is no fault.

original: de ni de la yang rtag tu med //
analyzed: de ni de la yang rtag tu med //
translated: But that is never so for you.

original: gal te 'jig rten ji ltar don myong ngo zhes pa lta bur nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ngo snyam du nges pa yin pa de'i phyir mthong ba'i rgyu nges pa yin par mthong bas na /üîΩ'di don myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten ji ltar don myong ngo zhes pa lta bur nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ngo snyam du nges pa yin pa de'i phyir mthong ba'i rgyu nges pa yin par mthong bas na / 'di don myong ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, you understand that this is the experience of the object,

original: myong ba myong ba ni ma yin no zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: myong ba myong ba ni ma yin no zhes rtogs so //
translated: but not the experience of the experience.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba yang myong ba yin na ni de ltar nges par 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba yang myong ba yin na ni de ltar nges par 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If the experience of the experience is the experience of the object, then it would be ascertained in that way.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rgyu zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni //
translated: The mere cause

original: kun tshe 'bras bu skyed pa min //
analyzed: kun tshe 'bras bu skyed pa min //
translated: does not always produce the effect.

original: rgyu ni lhan cig byed pa la //
analyzed: rgyu ni lhan cig byed pa la //
translated: The cause is dependent on the simultaneous

original: brten nas byed par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: brten nas byed par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: conditions in order to produce the effect.

original: de nyid ston pa ni /üîΩdon la'ang de ni rtag tu med//
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni / don la'ang de ni rtag tu med//
translated: To demonstrate that very point, he says:üîΩIt is not always in the object.

original: don la'ang rtag tu nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don la'ang rtag tu nges pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not always ascertained in the object,

original: la lar 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because error is sometimes seen.

original: yang na rtag tu don la nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yang na rtag tu don la nges pa kho na'o //
translated: Or, it is always ascertained only in the object.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i rnam pa nyid nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i rnam pa nyid nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the form of the cognition is ascertained as having the nature of experience.

original: nye bar btags pas de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar btags pas de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is so by the designation,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: nye bar 'dogs pas rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang du'ang gtso bor 'jug pa'i sa //
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pas rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro // gang du'ang gtso bor 'jug pa'i sa //
translated: because it is not possible to understand by designation.üîΩThe cognition does not see any object

original: don dag 'gas kyang mthong ba med //
analyzed: don dag 'gas kyang mthong ba med //
translated: in any way as principal.

original: de med pas na nyer 'dogs pa'i //
analyzed: de med pas na nyer 'dogs pa'i //
translated: And since it does not exist,

original: rtogs pa skye bar gal 'gyur //
analyzed: rtogs pa skye bar gal 'gyur //
translated: how can the designation arise?

original: des na 'di don to snyam pa'i nges pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs la brtan pa can yin gyi myong ba tsam las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di don to snyam pa'i nges pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs la brtan pa can yin gyi myong ba tsam las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment that this is the meaning is based on the power of beginningless latent impressions, and not on what is produced from mere experience.

original: rmi lam du yang don mthong ba ni yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rmi lam du yang don mthong ba ni yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Since it is not the case that one sees an object even in a dream,

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: in that case,

original: don to snyam pa'i nges par ni 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: don to snyam pa'i nges par ni 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: there is still the ascertainment that this is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir don myong ba yang nges pa med pa dang / de med pa dang / de med kyang yod pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa ni nges pa nyid @98a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir don myong ba yang nges pa med pa dang / de med pa dang / de med kyang yod pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa ni nges pa nyid @98a * //
translated: Therefore, the experience of the object is also uncertain, and even if it does not exist, it exists.

original: ma yin pas ji ltar de las de kho na rnam par gnas /
analyzed: ma yin pas ji ltar de las de kho na rnam par gnas /
translated: Since certainty is not certain, how can the object be established from that?

original: yod pa nyid kyis rgyu yod na //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyis rgyu yod na //
translated: If the cause exists due to existence,

original: myong ba med pa'ang ci yi phyir //
analyzed: myong ba med pa'ang ci yi phyir //
translated: why is there no experience?

original: nyams su myong ba'i myong ba rgyu thams cad yod pa yin te /üîΩde lta na yang nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ci zhig ltar lhan cig byed pa ma tshang bas na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i myong ba rgyu thams cad yod pa yin te / de lta na yang nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ci zhig ltar lhan cig byed pa ma tshang bas na /
translated: The experience of experience has all causes.üîΩEven so, there is no certainty.

original: mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: How is it that it does not occur due to the incompleteness of the assemblage of causes?

original: 'on ni nges pa las myong ba gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on ni nges pa las myong ba gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: But certainty does not exist due to experience,

original: nyams su myong ba la yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba la yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in experience.

original: des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is mere prattle.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid kyis nyams su myong ba rnam par 'jog na ni /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid kyis nyams su myong ba rnam par 'jog na ni /
translated: If experience is posited by the aspect of that,

original: nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ba dgag pa med do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ba dgag pa med do //
translated: there is no refutation of the experience of experience.

original: rgyu gzhan gyi med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis nges pas ni myong ba med par nges par 'jig par mi nus so //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyi med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis nges pas ni myong ba med par nges par 'jig par mi nus so //
translated: But it is not possible to ascertain that there is no other cause without experiencing it.

original: rgyu gzhan med do zhes bya bar rtogs kyi myong ba med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan med do zhes bya bar rtogs kyi myong ba med par ni ma yin no //
translated: One can only ascertain that there is no other cause, but not that there is no experience.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang dkar sogs mthong ba na //
analyzed: gzhan yang dkar sogs mthong ba na //
translated: when one sees white, etc.,

original: dkar sogs min par gsal bar smra //üîΩrang bzhin rig pa gsal ba ni //
analyzed: dkar sogs min par gsal bar smra // rang bzhin rig pa gsal ba ni //
translated: one clearly speaks of the absence of white, etc.

original: skyes pa'i snang ba 'di gang yin //
analyzed: skyes pa'i snang ba 'di gang yin //
translated: What is the appearance that arisesüîΩwhen one is aware of the nature of white, etc.?

original: de ni dkar sogs mngon gsal las //
analyzed: de ni dkar sogs mngon gsal las //
translated: Is it the same as the appearance of white, etc.,

original: gzhan dngos 'on te bdag ltar yin //
analyzed: gzhan dngos 'on te bdag ltar yin //
translated: or is it something else, like the self?

original: don yod pa tsam ni don yod pa mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don yod pa tsam ni don yod pa mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: The mere existence of an object is not the seeing of an object,

original: don mthong ba la ni gdon mi za bar don yod pa tsam las bla lhag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: don mthong ba la ni gdon mi za bar don yod pa tsam las bla lhag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: because in order to see an object, it must be something more than the mere existence of an object.

original: gal te bla lhag par gyur pa de snang ba las phyi rol du 'gyur ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bla lhag par gyur pa de snang ba las phyi rol du 'gyur ba yin na ni /
translated: If that which is more than the mere existence of an object is external to the appearance,

original: de yang don gyi rang bzhin nyid yin pas ji ltar don mthong ba yin /
analyzed: de yang don gyi rang bzhin nyid yin pas ji ltar don mthong ba yin /
translated: then since it is the nature of an object, how can it be the seeing of an object?

original: de'i phyir de ni snang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni snang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is apparent.

original: dkar po la sogs pa mthong ba na /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa mthong ba na /
translated: When white, etc., is seen,

original: des yongs su gsal ba'i rig pa'i snang ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: des yongs su gsal ba'i rig pa'i snang ba gang yin pa /
translated: the appearance of the cognition that is illuminated by it

original: de yang dkar po la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba las gzhan yin nam /
analyzed: de yang dkar po la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba las gzhan yin nam /
translated: is either different from the manifestation of white, etc.,üîΩor it is not different.

original: 'on te gzhan ma yin zhes rtogs pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan ma yin zhes rtogs pa gnyis so //
translated: The two alternatives are to be understood.

original: khyed kyis 'dod pa'i dkar po la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: khyed kyis 'dod pa'i dkar po la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba gang yin pa /
translated: If the manifestation of white, etc., which you accept,

original: gzhan dngos yin na gsal ba ni //
analyzed: gzhan dngos yin na gsal ba ni //
translated: is different,

original: gsal ba min ji ltar dkar gsal 'gyur //
analyzed: gsal ba min ji ltar dkar gsal 'gyur //
translated: how can the manifestation be white, since it is not the manifestation of white?

original: myong ba gsal ba ma yin pas ni ;
analyzed: myong ba gsal ba ma yin pas ni ;
translated: Since the manifestation is not manifest,

original: 'ga' yang mngon par gsal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang mngon par gsal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nothing would be manifest.

original: de mngon par gsal ba'i rang bzhin rig pas byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de mngon par gsal ba'i rang bzhin rig pas byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon par gsal ba yin no //
translated: That which is produced by the nature of the manifestation of that is the manifestation itself.

original: gzhan lkog tu gyur pa ni mig la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur gyi gsal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan lkog tu gyur pa ni mig la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur gyi gsal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were different, it would be like the eye, etc., and would not be manifest.

original: de ni mig la sogs pa @98b las tha dad pas tshad mas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni mig la sogs pa @98b las tha dad pas tshad mas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not perceived by a valid cognition, because it is different from the eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa tsam nyid las mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa tsam nyid las mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere eye, etc. themselves accomplish what is desired.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa de nyid mngon par gsal bar smra ba gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa de nyid mngon par gsal bar smra ba gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not direct perception, then it is not clear to others.

original: gal te mngon sum yin pa'i gsal ba skyed pa de lta na yang de nyid de skyes par zad mod don gsal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum yin pa'i gsal ba skyed pa de lta na yang de nyid de skyes par zad mod don gsal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Even if it generates a clear direct perception, it is just that which is generated. How can the object be clear?

original: gzhan skyes pa ni gzhan la ci yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan skyes pa ni gzhan la ci yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is generated from another, it does not become anything at all.

original: de don la yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de don la yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is in the object,

original: don la zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ci yod /
analyzed: don la zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ci yod /
translated: what is the connection with ‚Äúin the object‚Äù?

original: don mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because the object is seen,

original: don mthong ba ma rtogs pa ma yin nam /üîΩji ltar mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur don las nyid do zhe na ;
analyzed: don mthong ba ma rtogs pa ma yin nam / ji ltar mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur don las nyid do zhe na ;
translated: isn‚Äôt the seeing of the object not understood?üîΩHow could it be said that ‚Äúit is seen‚Äù? If you say that it is from the object,üîΩwhat is this so-called ‚Äúobject‚Äù?

original: las zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te don tsam las lhag par 'gyur ba yin te rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te don tsam las lhag par 'gyur ba yin te rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is more than just the object, it is understood.

original: de la yang rtogs pa gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang rtogs pa gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, there would be an infinite regress of cognitions.

original: des na las nyid yin pas de yang gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na las nyid yin pas de yang gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: And in that case, the action would be cognized by another, and so on ad infinitum.

original: des na yang las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa las mi grol lo //üîΩde'i phyir / shes pa gzhan yin de gsal min //
analyzed: des na yang las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa las mi grol lo // de'i phyir / shes pa gzhan yin de gsal min //
translated: And in that case, there would be an infinite regress of actions, and one would never be free from action.üîΩTherefore:

original: 'gro ba ma lus gsal ma yin //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus gsal ma yin //
translated: Cognition is not clear, and it is not the case that all beings are clear.

original: sgron ma las bzhin du don la mdangs gsal ba'i rang bzhin bskyed pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgron ma las bzhin du don la mdangs gsal ba'i rang bzhin bskyed pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the nature of the light of the object is merely generated, as in the case of a lamp.

original: 'on kyang shes pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba yin no //
translated: Rather, the nature of cognition is clear.

original: gal te de mngon sum ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de mngon sum ma yin na ni /
translated: If it is not manifest,

original: de ji ltar don gsal ba yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar don gsal ba yin /
translated: how can it be clear with respect to the object?

original: rang gi ngo bos gsal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos gsal lo zhe na /
translated: If it is clear by virtue of its own nature,

original: thams cad gsal bar thal lo //
analyzed: thams cad gsal bar thal lo //
translated: it follows, absurdly, that everything is clear.

original: rang gi khyad par las so zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi khyad par las so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is clear by virtue of its own particular nature,

original: shes pa don med do //
analyzed: shes pa don med do //
translated: then cognition is meaningless.

original: de lta bu nyid gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is clear in virtue of being just that,

original: 'di gang gis rtogs /
analyzed: 'di gang gis rtogs /
translated: by what is it cognized?

original: gsal ba gzhan gyis so zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyis so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is cognized by another clear cognition,

original: ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: that is not so. Why?

original: gsal ba gsal gzhan gyis gsal na'ang //
analyzed: gsal ba gsal gzhan gyis gsal na'ang //
translated: If it is manifest by another manifestation,

original: thug pa med par thal 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal 'gyur gyi //
translated: there would be an infinite regress.

original: gang gis gsal ba gzhan de'ang mi rtogs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gis gsal ba gzhan de'ang mi rtogs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the other manifestation is not perceived by that.

original: gsal ba snga mas rang gi ngo bo nyid gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba snga mas rang gi ngo bo nyid gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the previous manifestation manifests its own nature.

original: rtogs pa med pa'i phyir yang gzhan gyis gsal /
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa'i phyir yang gzhan gyis gsal /
translated: And because there is no perception, it is manifest by another.

original: gsal ba gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs pas thug pa med do //
translated: There is no infinite regress because it follows another manifestation.

original: de'i phyir gyi ngo bo nyid rtogs na mngon par gsal ba rtogs par rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gyi ngo bo nyid rtogs na mngon par gsal ba rtogs par rig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, when the nature is perceived, the manifestation is known to be manifest.

original: de lta ma yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni /
translated: If it were not so,

original: 'di mngon par gsal lo zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ltar / mngon par 'brel par shes med par //
analyzed: 'di mngon par gsal lo zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur ro // 'di ltar / mngon par 'brel par shes med par //
translated: it would not be known that this is manifest.üîΩThus:

original: ji ltar de yi khyad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de yi khyad par 'gyur //
translated: How could there be a difference without the perception of the connection?

original: don mthong @99a * //
analyzed: don mthong @99a * //
translated: Seeing the object

original: do zhes bya ba ni mthong ba khyad par nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: do zhes bya ba ni mthong ba khyad par nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: is the perception of the difference of seeing.

original: khyad par ma bzung bar yang khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par can 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ma bzung bar yang khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par can 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: And without apprehending the difference, the possessor of the difference is apprehended as distinguished.

original: ba lang ngo zhes khyad par du bzung ba nyid las ba lang nyid ci zhig mthong ba yod ce na /
analyzed: ba lang ngo zhes khyad par du bzung ba nyid las ba lang nyid ci zhig mthong ba yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the two?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: ba lang nyid ni ba lang ma yin pa nyid las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang nyid ni ba lang ma yin pa nyid las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of oxness is the opposite of non-oxness.

original: rtogs pa ni ma rtogs pa las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin du khyed 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa ni ma rtogs pa las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin du khyed 'dod pa yin te /
translated: You assert that understanding is the opposite of non-understanding.

original: de lta yin na don rang rig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na don rang rig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that the object would be reflexive awareness.

original: khyed ni rtogs pa tha dad par yang 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed ni rtogs pa tha dad par yang 'dod pa yin no //
translated: You also assert that understanding is different.

original: de yang ma rtogs na ji ltar rtogs pa po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin /
analyzed: de yang ma rtogs na ji ltar rtogs pa po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin /
translated: And if that is not understood, how can it be the reason for the convention ‚Äúunderstander‚Äù?

original: 'o na ji ltar khyed la yang rtogs pa tha dad par ma rtogs pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur khyed kyi ltar na yang /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar khyed la yang rtogs pa tha dad par ma rtogs pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur khyed kyi ltar na yang /
translated: Well then, for you also, how could the convention ‚Äúunderstanding of non-understanding‚Äù be different from understanding?

original: rtogs pa de dang de las tha dad pa'i don yang rtogs so zhes ni khas ma blangs so zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa de dang de las tha dad pa'i don yang rtogs so zhes ni khas ma blangs so zhe na /
translated: According to you, it is not asserted that the object is different from that understanding.

original: ji ltar de nye bar btags pa las yin pa de ltar ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de nye bar btags pa las yin pa de ltar ni /
translated: Just as it is imputed,

original: bstan zin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: bstan zin pas skyon med do //
translated: so it has been explained, and there is no fault.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga ma mthong ba'i phyir na khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga ma mthong ba'i phyir na khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since neither is seen, there is no apprehension of a distinction.

original: 'di ni / gang phyir gnyis la gcig rtogs tshe //
analyzed: 'di ni / gang phyir gnyis la gcig rtogs tshe //
translated: This is so because:

original: gnyis pa mthong ba yod ma yin //üîΩdon rtogs pa'i dus su na mthon ba rtogs pa med la /
analyzed: gnyis pa mthong ba yod ma yin // don rtogs pa'i dus su na mthon ba rtogs pa med la /
translated: When one is apprehended, the other is not seen.üîΩWhen the object is apprehended, the seeing is not apprehended.

original: rtogs pa'i dus su ni don mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus su ni don mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: When the seeing is apprehended, the object is not apprehended.

original: ji ltar khyad par can du mi rtogs /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par can du mi rtogs /
translated: So how can there be apprehension of a distinction?

original: des na 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di ni rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di ni rig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this is just your own understanding of how this is.

original: gnyis dag 'brel bas mthong ba na //
analyzed: gnyis dag 'brel bas mthong ba na //
translated: When there is a connection between the two,

original: mthong zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur //
translated: it is ascertained that there is seeing.

original: mthong ba zhes nges pa yang 'brel pa nges pa nyid do ;
analyzed: mthong ba zhes nges pa yang 'brel pa nges pa nyid do ;
translated: And the ascertainment that there is seeing is just the ascertainment of a connection.

original: / des na khyed kyis 'dod pas 'di lta bu nyams su myong ba nyid las 'gyur ba yin pas khyed la tshul ni med do //
analyzed: / des na khyed kyis 'dod pas 'di lta bu nyams su myong ba nyid las 'gyur ba yin pas khyed la tshul ni med do //
translated: Therefore, since this is just the experience of what you assert, you have no method.

original: nged kyi ltar na ni stobs dang ldan pa'i bag chags kyi rlung gi shugs kyis bskyod pa'i bdag nyid can don gyi ljon shing gi rtogs pa'i grib ma gzhan du bab cing nges pa'i lo ma skye'i gzhan du lhags pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa tsam nyid las
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na ni stobs dang ldan pa'i bag chags kyi rlung gi shugs kyis bskyod pa'i bdag nyid can don gyi ljon shing gi rtogs pa'i grib ma gzhan du bab cing nges pa'i lo ma skye'i gzhan du lhags pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa tsam nyid las
translated: According to us, the shadow of the tree of the object, which is moved by the force of the powerful wind of latent propensities, falls elsewhere, and the leaf of ascertainment grows elsewhere.

original: de kho na rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that reality is ascertained merely by that.

original: des na don rtogs pa yang med la /
analyzed: des na don rtogs pa yang med la /
translated: Thus, there is no realization of the object,

original: 'di don ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa skyes pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di don ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa skyes pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and there is no arising of ascertainment that this is not the object.

original: de bas na khyed kyi 'dod pa ni zab mo ma yin no zhes rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na khyed kyi 'dod pa ni zab mo ma yin no zhes rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that your assertion is not profound.

original: ci ste / gang gis @99b mthong ba 'dra ba ni //
analyzed: ci ste / gang gis @99b mthong ba 'dra ba ni //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe seeing of the object is like this:‚Äù

original: sems gzhan gyis ni mthong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sems gzhan gyis ni mthong 'gyur ba //
translated: The seeing by another mind

original: de la mthong zhes brjod ce na //
analyzed: de la mthong zhes brjod ce na //
translated: is called seeing.

original: 'di 'dra las ni rang rig grub //
analyzed: 'di 'dra las ni rang rig grub //
translated: From this, self-awareness is established.

original: 'di snyam du 'dra ba'i bdag nyid rig pa'i phyir ni don mthong ngo zhes nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'dra ba'i bdag nyid rig pa'i phyir ni don mthong ngo zhes nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúIt is not ascertained that the object is seen because of the awareness of a similar nature.

original: 'o na 'di'i de lta bur gyur ba nyid rig pa gzhan gyis rig pa las te ;
analyzed: 'o na 'di'i de lta bur gyur ba nyid rig pa gzhan gyis rig pa las te ;
translated: But in that case, the existence of that object is ascertained by the cognition of another cognition,

original: dper na dbyug pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dbyug pa can zhes de las gzhan gyi de lta bur gyur pa myong bas yongs su bzung ba na nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na dbyug pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dbyug pa can zhes de las gzhan gyi de lta bur gyur pa myong bas yongs su bzung ba na nges pa yin no //
translated: just as a man with a stick is called ‚Äústick-holder,‚Äù and the existence of that man is ascertained by the experience of another person.

original: rang rig pas ni khyad par dang khyad par can du gyur pa'i don 'dzin par gang du yang mi dmigs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pas ni khyad par dang khyad par can du gyur pa'i don 'dzin par gang du yang mi dmigs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: But the self-knowing cognition never observes any object as qualified or as a qualifier.

original: khyed kyi 'dir rang rig gi phyogs nyid la gnod de /
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dir rang rig gi phyogs nyid la gnod de /
translated: Here, the opponent‚Äôs position of self-knowing cognition is undermined.

original: 'di ltar / khyad par dang ni khyad par can //
analyzed: 'di ltar / khyad par dang ni khyad par can //
translated: The qualifier and the qualified

original: gnyi ga dam pa'i don du min //
analyzed: gnyi ga dam pa'i don du min //
translated: are not ultimate.

original: gang tshe 'ga' zhig gi //
analyzed: gang tshe 'ga' zhig gi //
translated: When one

original: khyad par can sogs nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: khyad par can sogs nyid du 'dod //
translated: wishes to cognize the qualifier, etc.,

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po dag don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po dag don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: The qualifier and the qualified are not ultimate,

original: res 'ga' khyad par can yang khyad par nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' khyad par can yang khyad par nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sometimes the qualifier is cognized as the qualified.

original: des na de lta bur gyur pa rtogs pa de ni blo kho na yin la /
analyzed: des na de lta bur gyur pa rtogs pa de ni blo kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, such a cognition is only mind.

original: de yang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rang rig pa grub bo //
analyzed: de yang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rang rig pa grub bo //
translated: And since it is the nature of reflexive awareness, reflexive awareness is established.

original: 'di ltar / 'di 'dra bab na rang rig grub //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di 'dra bab na rang rig grub //
translated: In this way, if it is like this, reflexive awareness is established.

original: don de lta bur gyur pa ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don de lta bur gyur pa ni med pa nyid do //
translated: But such an object does not exist.

original: gal te blo yang rang rig pa ma yin na ni khyad par dang khyad par can ma yin pa'i don nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te blo yang rang rig pa ma yin na ni khyad par dang khyad par can ma yin pa'i don nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If mind is not reflexive awareness, then it would be cognition of an object that is not qualified by the qualifier.

original: ci ste rang gi dngos min na //
analyzed: ci ste rang gi dngos min na //
translated: If it is not its own nature,üîΩhow can it cognize the nature of another?

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi ngo bor rig / gang gis bdag nyid rang bzhin mi rig pa de'i ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi ngo bor rig / gang gis bdag nyid rang bzhin mi rig pa de'i ltar na /
translated: According to those who say that mind does not cognize its own nature,

original: 'o na ni gzhan gyis rang bzhin rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni gzhan gyis rang bzhin rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be cognition of the nature of another.

original: de yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not qualified by the qualifier,

original: ji ltar de'i khyad par can du rtogs //
analyzed: ji ltar de'i khyad par can du rtogs //
translated: so how can it be cognized as qualified by it?

original: 'on te de'i rang bzhin mthong ba skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te de'i rang bzhin mthong ba skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: But if it is the arising of the seeing of its nature,

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that its own nature is cognized.

original: phyis gzhan gyis de'i rang bzhin mthong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: phyis gzhan gyis de'i rang bzhin mthong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If later another sees its nature,

original: mthong bar snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mthong bar snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is the appearance of seeing.

original: 'o na dang po khyad par mthong ba med par gzung ba phyis gzhan gyis de'i khyad par nyid du ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: 'o na dang po khyad par mthong ba med par gzung ba phyis gzhan gyis de'i khyad par nyid du ji ltar rtogs /
translated: But if at first there is no seeing of its distinction, how can it be known later by another that it has that distinction?

original: 'on te phyis rtogs pa des na nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te phyis rtogs pa des na nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: But if it is known later, then there is no fault.

original: de yang yang dag pa nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: But that is not correct.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar // de yi ngo bor rig pa de //
analyzed: 'di ltar // de yi ngo bor rig pa de //
translated: That which is cognized as its nature

original: sems gzhan gyis ni phyis nas de //
analyzed: sems gzhan gyis ni phyis nas de //
translated: By another mind later

original: @100a * // rang bzhin de nyid du rig go //
analyzed: @100a * // rang bzhin de nyid du rig go //
translated: Is known as its nature.

original: khyad par can gyi ma yin /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi ma yin /
translated: It is not known as distinguished.

original: mthong ba'i yul ni rang rtogs pa'i dus su khyad par can ma yin pa nyid du rig pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul ni rang rtogs pa'i dus su khyad par can ma yin pa nyid du rig pa yin no //
translated: The object seen is known as undistinguished at the time of its own cognition.

original: de'i dus phyis kyang de'i rang bzhin rig pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i dus phyis kyang de'i rang bzhin rig pa yin na /
translated: If it is known later as its nature,

original: rang bzhin de nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then it is known as its nature.

original: des de rang gi khyad par can du rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des de rang gi khyad par can du rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not known as distinguished by that.

original: de ltar min na sngon rig pa //
analyzed: de ltar min na sngon rig pa //
translated: If it were not so, then previouslyüîΩconsciousness would not have been aware of the other.
