original: rang rig pa ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: This is reflexive awareness:

original: gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin par gyur pa gsal ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩde phyir rang chos ltos med can //
analyzed: gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin par gyur pa gsal ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o // de phyir rang chos ltos med can //
translated: It is called ‚Äúclarity‚Äù because it is not the domain of another.

original: don chos yan gar ba las ni //
analyzed: don chos yan gar ba las ni //
translated: Therefore, it has no properties that depend on something else.

original: blo ni rjes su dpog ma yin //
analyzed: blo ni rjes su dpog ma yin //
translated: The mind is not inferred fromüîΩThe mere fact of the existence of objects.

original: blo rtogs mngon sum gang yin pa //
analyzed: blo rtogs mngon sum gang yin pa //
translated: The realization of the mind is direct perception.üîΩ

original: rang chos rang blo las gzhan ci //
analyzed: rang chos rang blo las gzhan ci //

original: blo la brten pa 'ga' zhig gis blo rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo la brten pa 'ga' zhig gis blo rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some, on the basis of cognition, infer the existence of the self.

original: yul la sogs pa'i chos thun mong pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba thun mong ba nyid rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa'i chos thun mong pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba thun mong ba nyid rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: The common property of the object, etc., is the common property of the object of inference.

original: des na bdag gi blo rjes su dpog par byed pa ni bdag gi chos su gyur dgos so //
analyzed: des na bdag gi blo rjes su dpog par byed pa ni bdag gi chos su gyur dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the self, which is the object of inference, must be a property of the self.

original: rang gi chos kyang blo las gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: rang gi chos kyang blo las gzhan ni med do //
translated: But there is no property of the self apart from cognition.

original: rang gi chos nyid blo nyid yin par zad pas de lkog tu gyur na /
analyzed: rang gi chos nyid blo nyid yin par zad pas de lkog tu gyur na /
translated: The very property of the self is cognition itself. Therefore, if the self is hidden,

original: rjes su dpog par byed pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpog par byed pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can it be inferred?

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa blo dang tshogs pa mtshungs pa las skyes pa @107b de dag ni bdag gi chos yin pas na de dag las rjes su dpog par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa blo dang tshogs pa mtshungs pa las skyes pa @107b de dag ni bdag gi chos yin pas na de dag las rjes su dpog par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that pleasure, etc., which arise from the combination of cognition and the self, are properties of the self, and therefore the self is inferred from them,

original: 'di la bshad pa /üîΩrgyu mtshungs pa las skye ba de //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa / rgyu mtshungs pa las skye ba de //
translated: we respond:üîΩWhat is the cause of the arising of pleasure, etc.,

original: blo las tha dad gang las yin //
analyzed: blo las tha dad gang las yin //
translated: which is the same as the cause of the arising of cognition?

original: gzhan skyes de yang 'khrul pa can //
analyzed: gzhan skyes de yang 'khrul pa can //
translated: And that which is produced from another is erroneous.

original: gal te bde ba yul dang dbang po la sogs pas skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bde ba yul dang dbang po la sogs pas skyed pa yin no //
translated: If pleasure is produced from objects, faculties, etc.,

original: thams cad rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: thams cad rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: it has been shown that all is of the nature of consciousness.

original: 'on te mthong bar gyur pa'i yul la bde ba skyes pa de las rang gi blo rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mthong bar gyur pa'i yul la bde ba skyes pa de las rang gi blo rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: But if pleasure is produced from an object that is seen, then one infers one‚Äôs own pleasure from that.

original: bde ba de yang gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: bde ba de yang gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: But that pleasure is not produced from another.

original: gzhan gyi bde ba la gzhan gyis rtogs par ji ltar nus she na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba la gzhan gyis rtogs par ji ltar nus she na /
translated: How can one know another‚Äôs pleasure?

original: rang rig pa ma yin na rnam par dbye ba 'di ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang rig pa ma yin na rnam par dbye ba 'di ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is not self-cognized, how can this distinction be made?

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa las kyang spu ldang ba nye bar skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa las kyang spu ldang ba nye bar skye ba nyid do //
translated: And in fear, etc., the hair stands on end.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin na de'i tshe gzhan dang 'brel pa mi rtogs so zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin na de'i tshe gzhan dang 'brel pa mi rtogs so zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: If pleasure, etc., are established as self-cognized, then it is reasonable to say that they are not cognized by another.

original: de lta ma yin na ni gzhan dang 'brel pa nyid gang gis bzlog / bdag gis spu ldang ba nges na bdag gi yin par rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni gzhan dang 'brel pa nyid gang gis bzlog / bdag gis spu ldang ba nges na bdag gi yin par rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: If it is ascertained that the hairs stand on end, then it is inferred that it is one‚Äôs own.

original: 'di yang ga las yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang ga las yin te /
translated: But how is this so?

original: gzhan gyi chung mas bde ba mi skyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung mas bde ba mi skyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the wife of another does not produce pleasure.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong bar gyur pa'i bdag nyid spu ldang ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pas na rang dang 'brel pa 'am ;
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong bar gyur pa'i bdag nyid spu ldang ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pas na rang dang 'brel pa 'am ;
translated: Since the hairs stand on end, etc., are produced by the nature of the experience of pleasure, etc., they are related to oneself.

original: de lta ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di gang du dgos /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di gang du dgos /
translated: Or else, how could it be said that it is not so?

original: rang gi bde bas spu ldang ba la sogs pa skyed par sgrub na /
analyzed: rang gi bde bas spu ldang ba la sogs pa skyed par sgrub na /
translated: If it is established that one‚Äôs own pleasure produces the hairs standing on end, etc.,

original: rang dang 'brel pa nyid rtogs la //
analyzed: rang dang 'brel pa nyid rtogs la //
translated: then one realizes that it is related to oneself.

original: rang dang 'brel pa nyid rtogs na yang des bskyed par rtogs pas phan tshun rten pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dang 'brel pa nyid rtogs na yang des bskyed par rtogs pas phan tshun rten pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: And if one realizes that it is related to oneself, then one realizes that it is produced by that. Thus there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: gzhan yang blo'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa 'am de'i rjes su byed pa blo rjes su byed pa yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa 'am de'i rjes su byed pa blo rjes su byed pa yin grang na /
translated: Moreover, if it is the case that the hairs standing on end, etc., follow the mind and are dependent on the mind, then they are dependent on the mind.

original: de la / gzugs sogs yul ni lnga po dang // dbang po dang ni dmigs pa dag / ma gtogs de yi 'bras bu gzhan //
analyzed: de la / gzugs sogs yul ni lnga po dang // dbang po dang ni dmigs pa dag / ma gtogs de yi 'bras bu gzhan //
translated: The verse says:üîΩThe five objects such as form, the sense faculty, and the object,

original: nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
translated: apart from these, there is no other result.

original: de la gnyis ni dbang po 'das //
analyzed: de la gnyis ni dbang po 'das //
translated: The two are the sense faculty and the object.

original: don lnga dag las /
analyzed: don lnga dag las /
translated: From the five objects,

original: gzugs mthong las //
analyzed: gzugs mthong las //
translated: one who sees form

original: skyes pa gzhan du srid bral ba //
analyzed: skyes pa gzhan du srid bral ba //
translated: is not free from existence in another life.

original: gang yin gcig kyang rtogs pa med //üîΩgnyis ni dbang po 'das zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gang yin gcig kyang rtogs pa med // gnyis ni dbang po 'das zhes bya ba ni //
translated: One who is not free from existence in another life does not understand.

original: dbang po dang dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang dmigs pa'o //
translated: The two are the sense faculty and the object.

original: gzugs la sogs pa don lnga po dag la ni gcig kyang gzugs mthong ba las skyes pa de lta bur gyur par rtogs pa @108a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa don lnga po dag la ni gcig kyang gzugs mthong ba las skyes pa de lta bur gyur par rtogs pa @108a * //
translated: From the five objects such as form, one who sees form does not understand in that way.

original: med do // gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs mthong ba las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med do // gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs mthong ba las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: Form and so on are not produced from seeing form.

original: rgyu gzhan las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are produced from other causes.

original: gzugs mthong ba las skyes pa nyid yin na ni de dag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba las skyes pa nyid yin na ni de dag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were produced from seeing form, they would be just that.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gzugs mthong don rnams thams cad la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs mthong don rnams thams cad la //
translated: From all objects seen,

original: yod phyir srog chags thams cad la //
analyzed: yod phyir srog chags thams cad la //
translated: Because of that, all living beings

original: tha dad de bzhin de las ni //
analyzed: tha dad de bzhin de las ni //
translated: Would have different forms, etc.

original: skye ba'i phyir yang de bzhin te //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir yang de bzhin te //
translated: And because of that, there would be birth,

original: skyes pa'i phyir yang don yang 'gyur //
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyir yang don yang 'gyur //
translated: And because of birth, there would be the meaning of ‚Äúobject.‚Äù

original: ji ltar gzugs mthong srog chags so so la tha dad pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs mthong srog chags so so la tha dad pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as living beings who see a form have different forms, etc.

original: des na gal te /
analyzed: des na gal te /
translated: Therefore, if

original: thams cad kyis ni dmigs nyid na //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni dmigs nyid na //
translated: All would be observed,

original: de yi khyad par nges pa na //
analyzed: de yi khyad par nges pa na //
translated: Then the particularities of that

original: de shes srog chags so so las //
analyzed: de shes srog chags so so las //
translated: Would be seen by each living being.

original: sna tshogs su ni snang bar thal //
analyzed: sna tshogs su ni snang bar thal //
translated: It follows that there would be a variety of appearances.

original: so so rang nyid dmigs na ni //
analyzed: so so rang nyid dmigs na ni //
translated: If each one were observed,

original: rang rig las na shes pa nyid //üîΩgal te gzugs la sogs pa srog chags so so la /
analyzed: rang rig las na shes pa nyid // gal te gzugs la sogs pa srog chags so so la /
translated: Consciousness would be self-awareness.

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin na /
translated: If form, etc. were different natures for each living being,üîΩall would observe it.

original: thams cad kyis dmigs par 'gyur bas gcig par gzugs la sogs pa tsam dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: thams cad kyis dmigs par 'gyur bas gcig par gzugs la sogs pa tsam dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, only form, etc. would be observed as one.

original: de ltar yang ma yin pa des na re zhig phyogs 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pa des na re zhig phyogs 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case. Therefore this position is not correct.

original: 'on te rang gi mthong bas bskyed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid du dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi mthong bas bskyed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid du dmigs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is the form, etc. that are produced by its own seeing that are perceived,

original: de lta yin na gzhan dag gis rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa khas blangs pas na don nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan dag gis rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa khas blangs pas na don nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since you are accepting reflexive awareness, you are undermining your own position.

original: de ste gzhan gyis dmigs pa yin na de lta na /
analyzed: de ste gzhan gyis dmigs pa yin na de lta na /
translated: But if you say that it is perceived by another,

original: de skyes pa nyid kyis na de la yang khyad par gnas yod par gyur la /
analyzed: de skyes pa nyid kyis na de la yang khyad par gnas yod par gyur la /
translated: then, since it would be different from the arising of that, it would be a different entity.

original: de yang gzhan gyis dmigs par bya bas na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis dmigs par bya bas na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since that also would be perceived by another, there would be an infinite regress.

original: rang gi rig pa dag gzhan gyi rig pas /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa dag gzhan gyi rig pas /
translated: If you say that reflexive awareness is perceived by another,

original: de ltar shes med gang yin te //
analyzed: de ltar shes med gang yin te //
translated: then what is not self-aware?

original: rtags zhes bya ba bab col te //
analyzed: rtags zhes bya ba bab col te //
translated: The so-called reason is nonsense.

original: ma rtogs pa nyid ni rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa nyid ni rtags ma yin no //
translated: What is not understood is not a reason.

original: des na rtags kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir blo zhes rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yin na ni zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na rtags kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir blo zhes rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yin na ni zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since there is no definition of a reason, it is not correct to say, ‚ÄúIf it is understood through inference called cognition.‚Äù

original: yang na don gzhan rtogs su chug pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: yang na don gzhan rtogs su chug pa de lta na yang /
translated: But even if you allow that it understands another object,üîΩthen what is the point of this?

original: rtags yod na yang de dang ni //
analyzed: rtags yod na yang de dang ni //
translated: Even if there were a reason,

original: lhan cig 'brel pa mthong med par //
analyzed: lhan cig 'brel pa mthong med par //
translated: it would not be seen to be related to that.

original: ji ltar rtogs 'gyur rtags dang ni //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs 'gyur rtags dang ni //
translated: How could there be an understanding of the reason

original: ma mthong ba yi gsal byed min //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yi gsal byed min //
translated: when the reason is not seen?

original: me la sogs pa mthong ba nyid rang las skyes pa'i du ba la sogs pa skyes pas rjes su dpog gi / gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me la sogs pa mthong ba nyid rang las skyes pa'i du ba la sogs pa skyes pas rjes su dpog gi / gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only by seeing fire, etc. that one infers the arising of smoke, etc. that has arisen from it, not from anything else.

original: sngar @108b ma mthong ba'i me ma mthong ba'i du bas rjes su dpog par byed na ni mthong ba ni med do //üîΩrtags de nyid las sngar de ni //
analyzed: sngar @108b ma mthong ba'i me ma mthong ba'i du bas rjes su dpog par byed na ni mthong ba ni med do // rtags de nyid las sngar de ni //
translated: If one were to infer from smoke not seen before, then there would be no seeing.

original: grub pa nyid du brjod na ni //üîΩde las yang ni dpe gzhan ni //
analyzed: grub pa nyid du brjod na ni // de las yang ni dpe gzhan ni //
translated: If you say that it is established from that very reason,

original: sgrub byed yin phyir thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: sgrub byed yin phyir thug med 'gyur //
translated: then another example would be required to establish that,üîΩand so on ad infinitum.

original: rjes su dpag par ni dpe spong bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par ni dpe spong bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In inference, an example is not rejected.

original: de lta yin na rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, it would not be inference,

original: mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: like direct perception.

original: mngon sum la tshad ma gzhan yod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin na 'di la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum la tshad ma gzhan yod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin na 'di la yang mtshungs so //
translated: because there is another valid cognition in regard to direct perception, inference is not itself.

original: des na dpe sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa de yang dpe gzhan las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pas na rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dpe sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa de yang dpe gzhan las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pas na rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that inference which proves the example is also from another example, and so there is an infinite regress, and so there is no understanding.

original: 'on te don gyis go bas sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: 'on te don gyis go bas sgrub par byed na /
translated: But if it is proved by implication,

original: de ltar rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //üîΩgal te rtogs pa med na don nyid mi 'thad do zhes rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med do /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med do // gal te rtogs pa med na don nyid mi 'thad do zhes rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med do /
translated: there is no one who understands it in that way.üîΩIf there is no understanding, then the meaning itself is not tenable.

original: gal te rtogs pa med na rtogs pa'i don med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa med na rtogs pa'i don med do zhe na /
translated: If there is no understanding, then there is no meaning of understanding.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig /
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig /
translated: What is this so-called understanding?

original: rtogs pas yul du byas pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pas yul du byas pa'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is the object of understanding,

original: rtogs pa ma rtogs na rtogs pa yul du byas pa de nyid gsal bar bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: rtogs pa ma rtogs na rtogs pa yul du byas pa de nyid gsal bar bya ba yin nam /
translated: if understanding is not understood, is that very object of understanding clarified?

original: mdun na gnas pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is just in front,

original: mdun na gnas pa yang ma rtogs par ji ltar rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa yang ma rtogs par ji ltar rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa yin /
translated: how can that which is in front, without being understood, prove understanding?

original: rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is,

original: de la yang mdun na gnas pa yod pas na 'di la thug pa med pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la yang mdun na gnas pa yod pas na 'di la thug pa med pa bshad zin to //
translated: then since it exists in front, it has been explained that this is an infinite regress.

original: des na mdun na gnas pa nyid dam /
analyzed: des na mdun na gnas pa nyid dam /
translated: Therefore, it is either that which exists in front,

original: don gyi rnam pa gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: or it is another aspect of the object.

original: rtogs pa ma grub na ni rtogs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma grub na ni rtogs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If the object is not established, then it is not cognized.

original: de'i phyir blo las don sgrub kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo las don sgrub kyi /
translated: Therefore, the object is established from the mind,

original: don las ji ltar yang de min //üîΩde ma grub par don rang nyid //
analyzed: don las ji ltar yang de min // de ma grub par don rang nyid //
translated: but the mind is not established from the object.üîΩIf the object is not established,

original: rab tu grub pa med phyir ro ;
analyzed: rab tu grub pa med phyir ro ;
translated: then the object itself is not established.

original: / blo las don grub po //
analyzed: / blo las don grub po //
translated: The object is established from the mind.

original: blo med par don grub na ni /
analyzed: blo med par don grub na ni /
translated: If the object were established without the mind,

original: thams cad thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then everyone would see everything.

original: gang gi tshe rang nyid blo don la byed pa 'jug par mthong ba de'i tshe don rtogs so zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang nyid blo don la byed pa 'jug par mthong ba de'i tshe don rtogs so zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: When one sees that the mind itself engages in the activity of the object, then it is said that the object is cognized.

original: gzhan du ni 'ga' yang rtogs so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'ga' yang rtogs so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be said that anything is cognized,

original: thams cad rang nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad rang nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: or that everything is cognized by itself.

original: de'i phyir don las blo grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don las blo grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind is not established from the object.

original: sngar bshad pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmngon sum blo dang de las ni //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir ro // mngon sum blo dang de las ni //
translated: because the previously explained faults would ensue.üîΩIf you see the cognition and its object,

original: brjod dang g-yo 'gul sogs mthong nas //
analyzed: brjod dang g-yo 'gul sogs mthong nas //
translated: and the expression, movement, and so on,

original: gzhan sel rjes dpag mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: gzhan sel rjes dpag mi 'gyur te //
translated: then you cannot infer the exclusion of other,

original: bdag la 'brel pa mthong med @109a * //üîΩphyir ; / gal te mngon sum gyi bdag nyid la blo dang / de dang 'brel pa can dag rnam pa ci zhig ltar mthong na de'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag la 'brel pa mthong med @109a * // phyir ; / gal te mngon sum gyi bdag nyid la blo dang / de dang 'brel pa can dag rnam pa ci zhig ltar mthong na de'i tshe /
translated: because you do not see a connection with yourself.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i rtags mthong ba las gzhan la yang blo rjes su dpog par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i rtags mthong ba las gzhan la yang blo rjes su dpog par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If you see the cognition that has the nature of direct perception and that which is connected with it, in some way, then at that time, you can infer the cognition of another from seeing the sign that is connected with it. But it is not tenable in any other way.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba'i don to zhes rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba'i don to zhes rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe infer the object that is seen by another,‚Äù

original: rang nyid kyis mthong ba ga las rtogs /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis mthong ba ga las rtogs /
translated: then how do you understand that you yourself see it?

original: rjes su dpog pa las so zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa las so zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe infer it,‚Äù

original: de la yang gzhan dgos pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan dgos pas thug pa med do //
translated: then since that also requires another, there is an infinite regress.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe understand it by means of direct perception,‚Äù

original: mngon sum don sngon po la sogs pa rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum don sngon po la sogs pa rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: then is it not the case that direct perception understands the object such as blue?

original: ji ltar dpe yin ;
analyzed: ji ltar dpe yin ;
translated: How is it an example?

original: rang dang 'brel pa yang rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: rang dang 'brel pa yang rtogs so zhe na /
translated: And it is also understood to be related to itself.

original: 'o na rang dang 'brel pa ni mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'o na rang dang 'brel pa ni mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: If that is so, then that which is related to itself is seen.

original: gal te de rtogs na ni bdag nyid kyang des rang rig pas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de rtogs na ni bdag nyid kyang des rang rig pas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is understood, then it is understood by itself through reflexive awareness.

original: de gzhan gyis rtogs na ni thug pa med do //
analyzed: de gzhan gyis rtogs na ni thug pa med do //
translated: If it is understood by another, there is an infinite regress.

original: de la yang mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de la yang mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: In that case, it is seen.

original: gzhan kho nar rtogs pa'i yul du gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan kho nar rtogs pa'i yul du gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it becomes an object of understanding by another.

original: des na don mthong bar gyur pa rtogs pa dang / mthong bar gyur pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: des na don mthong bar gyur pa rtogs pa dang / mthong bar gyur pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the seen object is understood, and the seeing is understood, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe rtogs pa rtogs pa de'i tshe ni mthong bar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtogs pa rtogs pa de'i tshe ni mthong bar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: When understanding understands, at that time it is not seen.

original: de'i tshe rtogs pa nyid dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtogs pa nyid dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, understanding itself would be the observed object.

original: des na yul tsam nyid rtogs kyi mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni ma yin pas na don gyis go ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yul tsam nyid rtogs kyi mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni ma yin pas na don gyis go ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, only the object is understood, not the seen. Thus, the understanding does not arise.

original: gzhan yang / yid kyi blo la rtags kyi don 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid kyi blo la rtags kyi don 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the mental cognition has no sign of an object at all.

original: de gang gis der rtags su 'gyur ba'i don mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: de gang gis der rtags su 'gyur ba'i don mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: There is no object that is directly perceived that would be the sign of that mental cognition.

original: dran pa nyid kyang mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nyid kyang mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: Memory itself is not direct perception.

original: des na yid kyi blo la don gyi rtags //
analyzed: des na yid kyi blo la don gyi rtags //
translated: Therefore, the mental cognition has no sign of an object.

original: rab tu grub pa yod min phyir //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa yod min phyir //
translated: Since it is not established,

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: the rest is called inference.

original: 'on te de yang rang rig pa la sogs pa don gyi snang ba snang ba yin pas na /
analyzed: 'on te de yang rang rig pa la sogs pa don gyi snang ba snang ba yin pas na /
translated: But if you say that because the appearance of the object, such as the awareness of itself, appears to it,

original: de las rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: it is inferred from that,

original: 'di la lan btab zin to //
analyzed: 'di la lan btab zin to //
translated: we have already responded to this.

original: de tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir don snang ba ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir don snang ba ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Since it is not a valid cognition, how could there be an appearance of an object?

original: snang ba ni mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: snang ba ni mthong ba yin te /
translated: An appearance is a seeing.

original: bden pa'am bden pa ma yin zhes bya bar the tshom za ba tsam du zad do zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa'am bden pa ma yin zhes bya bar the tshom za ba tsam du zad do zhe na /
translated: It is merely a doubt as to whether it is true or not true.üîΩWhat is this so-called not true?

original: bden pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / slu ba gang yin pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / slu ba gang yin pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: It is that which is deceptive.

original: de'i rang bzhin la slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its nature is not deceptive.

original: rang @109b bzhin der ni gdon mi za bar bden par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang @109b bzhin der ni gdon mi za bar bden par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: And that nature is certainly true.

original: bden pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad byed pas bden pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad byed pas bden pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not true because it is a convention of what is not true,

original: tha snyad 'di ci zhig / tshad ma'o zhen /üîΩtshad mas rtogs pa ji ltar mi bden /
analyzed: tha snyad 'di ci zhig / tshad ma'o zhen / tshad mas rtogs pa ji ltar mi bden /
translated: what is this convention?üîΩIf you say that it is a valid cognition,üîΩhow can the realization by a valid cognition be untrue?

original: mi bden pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is realized as untrue,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: mi bden pa nyid de'i rang bzhin las ma rtogs par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid de'i rang bzhin las ma rtogs par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not realized as other than its nature, which is not untrue.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam rtogs kyi don bya ba gzhan ni ma yin pas so zhes bya ba yang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam rtogs kyi don bya ba gzhan ni ma yin pas so zhes bya ba yang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not correct to say that it is the realization of its own nature alone and not of another object,

original: de lta yin na rang rig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na rang rig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in that case it would follow, absurdly, that it would be autocognition.

original: gzhan gyis rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is cognized by another,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dran pas mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid du mngon bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pas mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid du mngon bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you are still fixated on the fact that it is seen by memory.

original: 'di la snga ma'i rang bzhin nyid ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la snga ma'i rang bzhin nyid ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the nature of the former does not exist, it is not cognized.

original: ci ste 'di yul du byed pa'o na ni dran pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'di yul du byed pa'o na ni dran pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is the object of that, then it is not memory.

original: rang rig pa nyid ni mngon sum tsam mo zhes rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ni mngon sum tsam mo zhes rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that self-awareness is simply direct perception.

original: rang rig pa nyid ni de ltar rtogs so zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ni de ltar rtogs so zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: It is conventional to say, ‚ÄúI realize it by means of self-awareness.‚Äù

original: gzhal bya dang bral ba'i rtogs pa nyid mi bden pa yin gyi 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya dang bral ba'i rtogs pa nyid mi bden pa yin gyi 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The mere realization that is devoid of an object is false, but it is not that it is beyond the world, and so on,

original: de ltar tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang don gyis go ba 'am /
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang don gyis go ba 'am /
translated: because there is no such convention.üîΩMoreover, it is understood by implication.

original: gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is understood by another.

original: blo gzhan gyis /üîΩkhyod kyi blo ni blo gzhan gyis //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyis / khyod kyi blo ni blo gzhan gyis //
translated: By another mind.

original: ji ltar rab tu gsal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu gsal bar 'gyur //
translated: How could your mind be illuminated by another mind?

original: blo dag phan tshun rab tu gsal bar byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: blo dag phan tshun rab tu gsal bar byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the two minds illuminate each other?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: gsal min rab tu mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gsal min rab tu mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: they are equally non-illuminated.

original: gsal bya gsal byed gang las yin //üîΩrab tu gnas pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun nam /
analyzed: gsal bya gsal byed gang las yin // rab tu gnas pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun nam /
translated: What is the basis of the illuminated and the illuminator?

original: gzhan du gsal bya gsal byed kyi dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan du gsal bya gsal byed kyi dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that things that are not of the nature of illumination illuminate each other or something else.

original: sgron ma'i 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin pa gsal bar byed kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma'i 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin pa gsal bar byed kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: A lamp illuminates a pot, etc. by its own nature of clear light, but not by anything else.

original: yul ni ji ltar gsal ba yin //üîΩgsal la ngo bo 'pho phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ni ji ltar gsal ba yin // gsal la ngo bo 'pho phyir ro //
translated: How is the object illuminated?üîΩBecause the nature of the illuminated is to be transferred to it.

original: rang nyid gsal ba la de las gzhan dag 'phos pa'i phyir gsal ba yin te ;
analyzed: rang nyid gsal ba la de las gzhan dag 'phos pa'i phyir gsal ba yin te ;
translated: The object is illuminated because the nature of the illuminator is transferred to it.

original: dper na mar me'i 'od la sogs pa gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me'i 'od la sogs pa gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the nature of the light of a lamp is to illuminate itself and other things.

original: gsal de'ang de yi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gsal de'ang de yi ngo bo nyid //
translated: The illumination is also the nature of that.

original: rang nyid rab tu gsal ba yin //üîΩ'o na ji ltar bum pa'i rang bzhin gzhan yin la 'od kyang gzhan yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan la /
analyzed: rang nyid rab tu gsal ba yin // 'o na ji ltar bum pa'i rang bzhin gzhan yin la 'od kyang gzhan yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan la /
translated: It is itself fully illuminated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'ang @110a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'ang @110a * //
translated: But if the nature of the lamp is one thing and the light is another, then the nature of consciousness will be one thing and form, etc.

original: gzhan yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: will be another.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de lta yin mod 'on kyang 'di //
analyzed: de lta yin mod 'on kyang 'di //
translated: Although that is so,üîΩit is like the lamp, etc.

original: myong las phyi rol sgron sogs bzhin //
analyzed: myong las phyi rol sgron sogs bzhin //
translated: from experience,

original: myong ba med par gsal bya dang // gsal bar byed par rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: myong ba med par gsal bya dang // gsal bar byed par rtogs ma yin //
translated: it is not understood that the object is illuminated or that it illuminates.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa dang yul dag gzhan nyid yin mod /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa dang yul dag gzhan nyid yin mod /
translated: If consciousness and objects are different,

original: de lta mod kyis rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: de lta mod kyis rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: then the nature of consciousness

original: sgron ma bzhin du rang gsal bar 'gyur dgos te /
analyzed: sgron ma bzhin du rang gsal bar 'gyur dgos te /
translated: would have to be self-illuminating like a lamp.

original: de nyid rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis gzung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis gzung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It is apprehended by another consciousness.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not correct.

original: de dang chos mtshungs nyid kyis ni //üîΩgal te rang las tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: de dang chos mtshungs nyid kyis ni // gal te rang las tha dad pa'i //
translated: By the same reasoning,üîΩif it is apprehended by a consciousness

original: rnam shes kyis ni 'di 'dzin na //
analyzed: rnam shes kyis ni 'di 'dzin na //
translated: that is different from itself,

original: rigs 'di phyi rol nyid du 'ang 'gyur //
analyzed: rigs 'di phyi rol nyid du 'ang 'gyur //
translated: then this type of object would be external.

original: 'on te phyi rol 'di min na //
analyzed: 'on te phyi rol 'di min na //
translated: But if it is not external,

original: rang rig nyid du ci mi 'gyur //üîΩde yang snang ba gzhan gyis ni //
analyzed: rang rig nyid du ci mi 'gyur // de yang snang ba gzhan gyis ni //
translated: why is it not self-awareness?üîΩMoreover, it is not illuminated

original: rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: by another appearance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de ltar blo la blo 'dod na //
analyzed: de ltar blo la blo 'dod na //
translated: If you assert that cognition cognizes itself,

original: blo ni rang nyid rig pa grub //
analyzed: blo ni rang nyid rig pa grub //
translated: then cognition is established as self-aware.

original: de ltar min na yul yang ni //
analyzed: de ltar min na yul yang ni //
translated: If that is not so, then the object

original: blo dang lhan cig chos mtshungs nyid //
analyzed: blo dang lhan cig chos mtshungs nyid //
translated: would be similar to cognition.

original: gal te rang nyid rab tu gsal ba'i blo la blo 'phos pa'i phyir /üîΩblos blo gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang nyid rab tu gsal ba'i blo la blo 'phos pa'i phyir / blos blo gsal ba yin na /
translated: If, because of the transference of cognition to itself, which is clearly manifest,üîΩcognition is the clarity of cognition,

original: 'o na ni blo nyid rig par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni blo nyid rig par byed pa yin no //
translated: then cognition itself is the illuminator.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: blo rang nyid gsal ba ma yin na /
analyzed: blo rang nyid gsal ba ma yin na /
translated: If cognition is not itself clarity,

original: de yang de'i rang bzhin can nyid kyis chos mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir blo'i gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i rang bzhin can nyid kyis chos mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir blo'i gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be the illuminator of itself because it would be similar to it in being of its nature.

original: de'i phyir ded kyi blo rang nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir ded kyi blo rang nyid //
translated: Therefore, cognition itself

original: gsal ba'i ngo bor rab gsal zhing //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bor rab gsal zhing //
translated: is clearly manifest in the nature of clarity.

original: gzhan der ngo bo 'phos pa yis //
analyzed: gzhan der ngo bo 'phos pa yis //
translated: Because of the transference of its nature to another,

original: gsal ba la ni rab gsal nyid //
analyzed: gsal ba la ni rab gsal nyid //
translated: it is clearly manifest in the clarity of another.

original: gzugs dang blo'i gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal bar byed pa'i dngos bo de lta bu nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang blo'i gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal bar byed pa'i dngos bo de lta bu nyid yin te /
translated: The object of illumination and the illuminator are like this.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gcig ni rang nyid rab tu gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: gcig ni rang nyid rab tu gsal ba yin la /
translated: One is clearly manifest in itself.

original: gzhan ni de'i rang bzhin du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni de'i rang bzhin du bskyed pa'o //
translated: The other is generated as its nature.

original: gal te blo gcig rab nyid rab tu gsal ba yin mod //
analyzed: gal te blo gcig rab nyid rab tu gsal ba yin mod //
translated: If one cognition is clear, then it is clear.

original: gzhan ni gsal bya dang 'dra ba yod pa las yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gsal bya dang 'dra ba yod pa las yin te /
translated: The other is like what is to be clarified, because it exists.

original: dper na pha'i gzugs 'dzin to zhes bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na pha'i gzugs 'dzin to zhes bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like saying that one holds the form of one's father.

original: 'dra ba yin yang de yis ni //
analyzed: 'dra ba yin yang de yis ni //
translated: Even though there is similarity,

original: blo gzhan rab tu gsal mi 'dod //üîΩrang nyid rab tu gsal phyir don //
analyzed: blo gzhan rab tu gsal mi 'dod // rang nyid rab tu gsal phyir don //
translated: we do not assert that another cognition is clear.üîΩBecause it is clear by itself,

original: de yi ngo bos rab gsal yin //
analyzed: de yi ngo bos rab gsal yin //
translated: the object is clear by its own nature.

original: gsal ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis gsal gyi //
analyzed: gsal ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis gsal gyi //
translated: That which is not clear is clarified by another,

original: gsal ba nyid ni blos mtshungs pa tsam gyis gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid ni blos mtshungs pa tsam gyis gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: but that which is clear is not clarified by mere similarity with cognition.

original: don dam pa ni @110b gsal ba ma yin pa yang gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa ni @110b gsal ba ma yin pa yang gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: The ultimate is not clear, and it is not clarified.

original: ji ltar don rab tu gsal zhe na /üîΩdon de'i ngo bor te /
analyzed: ji ltar don rab tu gsal zhe na / don de'i ngo bor te /
translated: How is the object clear?üîΩThe object is clear by its own nature,

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba yin gyi gzhan gyis gsal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba yin gyi gzhan gyis gsal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: by the nature of clarity, but not by another.

original: blo dag ni rang nyid yang /
analyzed: blo dag ni rang nyid yang /
translated: Cognitions are clear by themselves.

original: rang nyid rab tu gsal bar mtshungs pa'i phyir na gsal bar bya ba gzhan par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid rab tu gsal bar mtshungs pa'i phyir na gsal bar bya ba gzhan par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Because it is similar to itself being well illuminated, it is not a thing that illuminates another.

original: dper sgron gnyis bzhin mar me dang // bum pa dag kyang de rten nas //
analyzed: dper sgron gnyis bzhin mar me dang // bum pa dag kyang de rten nas //
translated: For example, like the two lamps, the light and the pot,

original: gsal bya gsal byed ngo bo yis //
analyzed: gsal bya gsal byed ngo bo yis //
translated: are not the essence of the illuminator and the illuminated.

original: tha snyad rab tu rgyas par byed //
analyzed: tha snyad rab tu rgyas par byed //
translated: The conventional is fully established.

original: sgron ma gnyis la 'dra ba dang // skye ba yod kyang /
analyzed: sgron ma gnyis la 'dra ba dang // skye ba yod kyang /
translated: Even though the two lamps are similar and arise,

original: phan tshun gsal ba gsal byed kyi dngos po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun gsal ba gsal byed kyi dngos po nyid ma yin no //
translated: they are not the essence of the illuminator and the illuminated of each other.

original: 'o na mar me dang bum pa gnyis ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mar me dang bum pa gnyis ji lta zhe na /
translated: Well then, how about the light and the pot?

original: mar me'i tshogs pa la bum pa de'i ngo bor skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me'i tshogs pa la bum pa de'i ngo bor skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pot arises in the assembly of the light as its essence.

original: des na de yang rang nyid rab tu gsal ba nyid kyis gsal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na de yang rang nyid rab tu gsal ba nyid kyis gsal ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is also illuminated by itself being well illuminated.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las kun brtags pa'i dmigs kyis bkar pa las de ltar tha snyad med pa yin gyi //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las kun brtags pa'i dmigs kyis bkar pa las de ltar tha snyad med pa yin gyi //
translated: In the same way, the conventional is not established by the imagined object distinguished by the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: don dam par ni spros pas chog go //üîΩyul dang dbang po tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: don dam par ni spros pas chog go // yul dang dbang po tsam gyis ni //
translated: But enough of this elaboration!üîΩIt is not certain that what is seen

original: mthong zhes bya bar nges ma yin //üîΩdes na gang las 'di 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya bar nges ma yin // des na gang las 'di 'gyur ba //
translated: is only the object and the sense faculty.üîΩTherefore, what is the other thing

original: gzhan de'ang mthong bar gdon mi za //üîΩgal te yul dang dbang po tsam las mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan de'ang mthong bar gdon mi za // gal te yul dang dbang po tsam las mthong ngo //
translated: from which this is produced?

original: snyam du nges pa yin na ni ;
analyzed: snyam du nges pa yin na ni ;
translated: If it is certain that what is seen is only the object and the sense faculty,

original: / thams cad mthong ngo zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / thams cad mthong ngo zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is certain that everything is seen.üîΩIf it is certain that what is seen is only the sense faculty,üîΩthen it is certain that the sense faculty is seen.üîΩIf it is certain that what is seen is only the seeing,

original: mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid mthong ngo zhes bya bar nges so zhe na /
analyzed: mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid mthong ngo zhes bya bar nges so zhe na /
translated: then it is certain that seeing itself is seen.

original: mthong bar gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig gang la mthong ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bar gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig gang la mthong ba skyes pa'o //
translated: What is this ‚Äúseeing‚Äù? It is that in which seeing arises.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces de nyid 'dri ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces de nyid 'dri ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this the same question as ‚ÄúWhat is seeing?‚Äù

original: gang la mig la sogs pa mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la mig la sogs pa mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: It is that in which the eye and so on are present.

original: mig mngon du phyogs so zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: mig mngon du phyogs so zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs /
translated: How is it known that the eye is present?

original: de la yang ji ltar zhes mthong ba nyid kyis tha snyad du byed pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang ji ltar zhes mthong ba nyid kyis tha snyad du byed pas thug pa med do //
translated: How is it known that it is present in that? In the same way, it is known through seeing. Thus there is an infinite regress.

original: 'on te mthong ba skyes pa tsam las nges so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba skyes pa tsam las nges so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is ascertained from the mere arising of seeing,

original: mthong bar gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig gang las mthong ba skyes /
analyzed: mthong bar gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig gang las mthong ba skyes /
translated: what is this so-called seeing? From what does seeing arise?

original: nyams su myong ba nyid las nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid las nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained from experience.

original: nyams su myang ba'i myong ba tsam las ni nyams su myang ngo zhes bya bar nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myang ba'i myong ba tsam las ni nyams su myang ngo zhes bya bar nges pa ma yin te /
translated: But from the mere experience of experience, it is not ascertained that ‚ÄúI experience.‚Äù

original: dkar po nyid nyams su ma myong bar dkar po nyid do zhes mi nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dkar po nyid nyams su ma myong bar dkar po nyid do zhes mi nges pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as, without experiencing whiteness, one does not ascertain that ‚Äúthis is white.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gang zhig nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i nges pa de lta bur gyur pa myong ba nyid las 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i nges pa de lta bur gyur pa myong ba nyid las 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, that ascertainment which follows experience is just from experience.

original: @111a * // de ltar nges pa ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: @111a * // de ltar nges pa ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Such ascertainment is reasonable.

original: dran pa las kyang bdag rig grub //
analyzed: dran pa las kyang bdag rig grub //
translated: And from memory, the self is established as cognizing itself.
